boat.name: Nell
boat.full_description:
Nell was a yacht which was sunk in Heybridge Creek as a blockship during 1939 - 1945 war. She was raised after the war and slipped in Dan Webb and Feeseys yard for restoration by J Walker. She was left near derelict gutted and with 3 planks out on the head of the slip until 1958 when she was bought by John Bray for £200. She was launched late 1958, accommodation and re-rigged during 1959. She was damaged by fire in1964. She sailed to Gravesend and taken ashore for iron floors to be fitted. She was burnt out beyond repair in 1968, the fire being started by vandals.

Her hull had lines similar to Itchen Ferry Smacks.
boat.short_description: Yacht built on Itchen Ferry lines, burnt out beyond repair in 1968.
